New Records: Jason Holder became the first West Indian to grab a hat-trick in T20Is
Key Match Events: Jason Holder picked up four wickets in four balls
West Indies bowled out England for 162 in 19.5 overs
England needed 180 runs to win but were bowled out for 162
Jason Holder sealed the deal for West Indies and the hosts clinched the T20I series 3-2
Pre-Game Insights: No specific pre-game insights were mentioned in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Kieron Pollard, the victorious skipper of West Indies, thanked his team for giving this victory and applauded his team for supporting each other
Moeen Ali, the skipper of England, said that West Indies were a better team and they played well
Miscellaneous Highlights: West Indies will be extremely pleased with the way they bowled and kept the English batters in check for the majority of the innings
England had to chase 180 from 20 overs and they had to start well with the bat which they did as Jason Roy made his intentions quite clear in the first over
Others: The article mentions that Jason Holder is the Player of the Match as well as the Series
